CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 3, 1943, pg. 4 reads: Here Is Democracy...Detroit Style!...A Story In Pictures - The Pittsburgh Courier's Charles Harris, staff photographer, was rushed to Detroit last week, after Langford James, Detroit staff photographer, had his arm seriously injured when police manhandled him as he was taking pictures. Here is the graphic picture story Mr. Harris "snapped" of the "raiding" and machine-gunning of the swank Vernor Apartment hotel, on the corner of Vernor and Brush...The lower insert shows two tenants of the building, snapped in foyer, as they told Courier reporters of losses sustained during the incident..."
TitMainTitle: Woman seated in armchair, and man standing in lobby of the Vernor Apartment hotel, Detroit, Michigan
